rating_overview.description: Heart conditions rated primarily based on METs (metabolic equivalents) or LVEF (left ventricular ejection fraction)

mets.description: Metabolic Equivalents - measure of energy expenditure during activity

lvef.description: Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction - percentage of blood pumped out with each heartbeat

levels.criteria: Workload of greater than 7 METs but not greater than 10 METs resulting in dyspnea, fatigue, angina, dizziness, or syncope; or continuous medication required

Workload of greater than 5 METs but not greater than 7 METs resulting in dyspnea, fatigue, angina, dizziness, or syncope; or evidence of cardiac hypertrophy or dilatation on electrocardiogram, echocardiogram or X-ray

More than one episode of acute congestive heart failure in the past year; or workload of greater than 3 METs but not greater than 5 METs resulting in dyspnea, fatigue, angina, dizziness, or syncope; or left ventricular dysfunction with an ejection fraction of 30-50%

Chronic congestive heart failure; or workload of 3 METs or less resulting in dyspnea, fatigue, angina, dizziness, or syncope; or left ventricular dysfunction with an ejection fraction of less than 30%

special_rating.note: Reevaluated after 3 months using standard heart rating criteria

hypertensive_heart_disease.description: Heart disease caused by chronic hypertension

levels.criteria: Permanent atrial fibrillation (lone atrial fibrillation), or one to four episodes per year of paroxysmal atrial fibrillation or other supraventricular tachycardia documented by ECG or Holter monitor
More than four episodes per year of paroxysmal atrial fibrillation or other supraventricular tachycardia documented by ECG or Holter monitor
1-4 episodes per year of sustained ventricular tachycardia or ventricular fibrillation documented by ECG/Holter
More than 4 episodes per year of sustained ventricular tachycardia or ventricular fibrillation
Chronic congestive heart failure or workload of 3 METs or less

pacemaker.note: Rate on residuals based on METs/symptoms

levels.criteria: Minimum rating thereafter, rate on residuals

cabg_or_stent.description: Coronary Artery Bypass Graft or Stent Placement
cabg_or_stent.post_procedure: Rate based on residuals (METs, LVEF) after recovery

mets_testing.exercise_testing: Gold standard - treadmill or bicycle stress test
mets_testing.interview_based: Can estimate METs based on reported activity tolerance when exercise test not possible
mets_testing.note: Examiner must document whether METs are from testing or interview

heart_conditions_secondary_to.connection: Long-term hypertension causes hypertensive heart disease
Diabetes significantly increases heart disease risk
Increases risk of arrhythmias and heart disease
Chronic stress associated with increased cardiac risk
Weight gain increases heart disease risk

agent_orange.description: Presumptive for veterans exposed to Agent Orange

tips_for_veterans: Bring ALL cardiac test results - echo, stress test, ECG
Describe activities that cause symptoms (dyspnea, fatigue, chest pain)
Report any hospitalizations for heart problems
Track episodes of arrhythmia if applicable
Report history of heart attack, CHF, or procedures
If exposed to Agent Orange, know that ischemic heart disease is presumptive
common_mistakes: Failing to describe symptom-limited activity level
Not claiming as secondary to hypertension or diabetes
important_notes: METs and LVEF are primary rating criteria
Ischemic heart disease is presumptive for Agent Orange exposure
100% rating for 3 months after MI, 1 year after transplant
Heart conditions often secondary to hypertension, diabetes, or sleep apnea
Symptoms during activity (dyspnea, fatigue, angina) are key
Keep copies of all cardiac testing results
